Notes: Experimentally did double blind on half the manuscripts. This line is just reporting the unblinded versions. Reviewers and journal were all US-based. The study used an ordinal scale of 1 = accept, 2 = revise (i.e. minor or major revisions), and 3 = reject. "Continuous data" = reviewer ordinal scores that haven't been rescaled between 0 and 1.

Experimentally did double blind on half the manuscripts. This line is just reporting the unblinded versions. Reviewers and journal were all US-based. The study used an ordinal scale of 1 = accept, 2 = revise (i.e. minor or major revisions), and 3 = reject. "Continuous data" = reviewer ordinal scores that haven't been rescaled between 0 and 1.

"Scores are on a scale of 1 (best) to 4 (worst), with almost all papers receiving more than one (usually two but occasionally more) review scores." "Continuous data" = reviewer ordinal scores that haven't been rescaled between 0 and 1.

The original categories were accept, provisionally accept, reject with resubmission, and reject. "Continuous data" = reviewer ordinal scores that haven't been rescaled between 0 and 1.
